  • Method Details

    • botEngine

      public double[] botEngine​(String refVelType)
      Algorithm Structure: Part A: Create a list of possible shots based on referenceVelocities Part B: Find the closest shot to the target within these possible shots Part C: Use this shot to hill climb... Between increasing/decreasing and rotating the velocity vector, choose which choice brings the ball closest to the goal during or after its shot. Repeat until a solution is found. Part D: If hill climbing fails AND we have not exhausted all shots, then expand the search space and start from Part A and try the next best shot. Repeat until a solution is found
      Parameters:
      refVelType - a string input which will decide how refrence velocities are made ("manhaattan" and "random" are valid inputs)
      Returns:
      initialVelocities A double array containing the solution velocities.

    • calculateStartVelocities

      public double[] calculateStartVelocities()
      Calculates the initial velocities of the ball in order to score, using a hill climbing approach.
      Specified by:
      calculateStartVelocities in interface Bot
      Returns:
      double[] containing the initial xVelocity on index [0] and zVelocity on index [1]

      public static double[] randomVelocity()
      This method will return a random velocity with total velocity smaller than 5;
      Returns:
      double[] containing the X and Y of the new vector.

    • getRandomErrorOffset

      public double[] getRandomErrorOffset​(double velocity1, double velocity2)
      This method is used for during caluclation error, it takes a velocity vector's x/y componenets and adds a random value between a range of numbers to simulate error.
      Parameters:
      velocity1 - The x component of the vector.
      velocity2 - The y componenet of the vector.
      Returns:
      double[] containing the new x/y components with added error.

    • shrinkVector

      public double[] shrinkVector​(double vX, double vY, double scale)
      This method shrinks a vector with a total velocity >= 5 to 5 by calculating its unit vector and scaling it down to equal 5
      Parameters:
      vX - The x component of the vector being calculated.
      vY - The 7 component of the vector being calculated.
      Returns:
      A double[] containing the new scaled velocities.
